message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible product for sale. I think it's a game-changer, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to offer it to you for $1500000.

I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I think $1500000 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to make a serious offer of $900000 for the product. I believe it's a fair price, considering the value it will bring to my business.

I understand that $900000 is a bit lower than what I was hoping for, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer you the product for $1200000. I believe it's a fair price considering the value it will bring to your business, and I'm willing to negotiate further if you're willing to meet me in the middle.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still not comfortable with the price of $1200000. I'm willing to make a counteroffer of $950000 for the product. I think this is a fair price, considering the value it will bring to my business, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

I'm starting to think we're getting close to a deal, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my target price. I can offer you the product for $1100000. This is as low as I'm willing to go, and I hope we can finalize the deal at this price.

I appreciate your concession, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price of $1100000. I'm willing to make a final counteroffer of $980000 for the product. I think this is a fair price, and I'm hoping we can finalize the deal at this price.

I've made a significant concession already, and I'm not willing to go any lower. I'm afraid I need to prioritize getting the best possible price for the product. I'm willing to walk away from the deal if we can't meet at a price that's more favorable to me. I'm going to make a final offer of $1050000. This is my last offer, and I expect it to be accepted.
